item.name: Spiked Armor +1
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 152, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Spiked Barding +1
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.
Barding is armor designed to protect an animal's head, neck, chest, and body.
Spiked barding provides a mount with an AC equal to 14 + the mount's Dexterity modifier (max 2). The mount makes Dexterity (Stealth) checks with disadvantage.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 152, Player's Handbook (2014) p. 157, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Spiked Armor of Acid Resistance
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
You have resistance to acid damage while you wear this armor.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 152, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Spiked Barding of Thunder Resistance
item.text:

item.name: Mariner's Spiked Armor
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
While wearing this armor, you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, whenever you start your turn underwater with 0 hit points, the armor causes you to rise 60 feet toward the surface. The armor is decorated with fish and shell motifs.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 181, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Mariner's Spiked Barding
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
While wearing this armor, you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, whenever you start your turn underwater with 0 hit points, the armor causes you to rise 60 feet toward the surface. The armor is decorated with fish and shell motifs.
Barding is armor designed to protect an animal's head, neck, chest, and body.
Spiked barding provides a mount with an AC equal to 14 + the mount's Dexterity modifier (max 2). The mount makes Dexterity (Stealth) checks with disadvantage.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 181, Player's Handbook (2014) p. 157, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Mithral Spiked Armor
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
Mithral is a light, flexible metal. A mithral chain shirt or breastplate can be worn under normal clothes. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithral version of the armor doesn't.
The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 182, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121

item.name: Mithral Spiked Barding
item.text:
Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.
Mithral is a light, flexible metal. A mithral chain shirt or breastplate can be worn under normal clothes. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithral version of the armor doesn't.
Barding is armor designed to protect an animal's head, neck, chest, and body.
Spiked barding provides a mount with an AC equal to 14 + the mount's Dexterity modifier (max 2). The mount makes Dexterity (Stealth) checks with disadvantage.
Source: Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 182, Player's Handbook (2014) p. 157, Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 121
